intro: Sisymbrium procumbens, commonly known as匍匐山萵, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, branching stems that often lie close to the ground, and it produces small, yellow flowers in early summer. The plant has pinnately divided leaves and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Sisymbrium procumbens is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants.
